The wiki's site name.
Domain URL.
Subdomain and domain name.

Outputs a Unicode directional mark that matches the wiki's default language's direction (`&lrm`; on left-to-right wikis, `&rlm`; on right-to-left wikis), useful in text with multi-directional text. Since 1.19, it depends on the [page content language](https://www.mediawiki.org/wiki/Special:MyLanguage/Manual:Language#page-content-lang).
Relative article path.
Relative script path.
Relative style path.
The wiki's MediaWiki version.
The wiki's default interface language.

Returns the [page identifier (page ID)](https://www.mediawiki.org/wiki/Special:MyLanguage/Help:Page_ID).

**[Expensive]** Returns the page identifier of the specified page.
Returns the language of the current page. The language code that this variable returns can be converted to a language name using `{{#language:...}}`.

Outputs the protection level (e.g. "autoconfirmed", "sysop") for a given action (e.g. "edit", "move") on the current page. Returns an empty string if not protected.

**[Expensive]** Outputs the protection level on the specified page.

Outputs the protection expiry (e.g. "20160418155030", "infinity") for a given action (e.g. "edit", "move") on the current page. Returns "infinity" if not protected.

**[Expensive]** Outputs the protection expiry on the specified page.
**[Expensive]** Returns the sources of any cascading protection acting on the current page or the specified page. Pages will not return their own title unless they transclude themselves.

Unique revision ID. It is always empty in preview, thus one can show an error message only in preview. May be disabled in [miser mode (all WMF wikis)](https://www.mediawiki.org/wiki/Special:MyLanguage/Manual:$wgMiserMode) returning `-` instead when not in preview.

**[Expensive]** Unique revision ID of the last revision on the specified page.

Day edit was made (unpadded number).

**[Expensive]** Day of edit from the last revision of the specified page.

Day edit was made (zero-padded number).

**[Expensive]** Day of edit from the last revision of the specified page.

Month edit was made (zero-padded number as of 1.17+, unpadded number in prior versions).

**[Expensive]** Month of edit from the last revision of the specified page.

Month edit was made (unpadded number).

**[Expensive]** Month of edit from the last revision of the specified page.

Year edit was made.

**[Expensive]** Year of edit from the last revision of the specified page.

Timestamp as of time of edit.

**[Expensive]** Timestamp as of time of edit on the specified page.

The username of the user who made the edit in question, or the user previewing an edit.

**[Expensive]** The username from the last revision on the specified page.
The size (bytes of wikitext) of the viewed revision of the page or preview.

Format the [display title](https://www.mediawiki.org/wiki/Special:MyLanguage/Display_title) of the current page, which is what is typically shown in a page's title header. The value must be equivalent to the default title: only capitalization changes to certain parts of the title (not all) and replacing spaces with underscores are allowed.

It can take a second argument of *noerror* or *noreplace* to suppress error messages when multiple displaytitles are used on one page or to make this `displaytitle` do nothing if a `displaytitle` was already specified earlier in the page.

Used for categorizing pages, sets a default [category sort key](https://www.mediawiki.org/wiki/Special:MyLanguage/Help:Categories). It can take a second argument of *noerror* or *noreplace* to suppress error messages when multiple defaultsortkeys are used on one page or to make this `defaultsort` do nothing if a `defaultsort` was already specified earlier in the page.
Number of wiki pages.
Number of pages in [content namespaces](https://www.mediawiki.org/wiki/Special:MyLanguage/Manual:Using_custom_namespaces#content-ns) that qualify as articles.
Number of uploaded files.
Number of wiki edits.
Number of registered users.
Number of users in the *sysop* [group](https://www.mediawiki.org/wiki/Special:MyLanguage/Manual:User_rights).
Number of active users, based on the criteria used in Special:Statistics.
**[Expensive]** Number of pages (including subcategories and files if no second argument is provided) in the given [category](https://www.mediawiki.org/wiki/Special:MyLanguage/Help:Categories).
Number of users in a specific [group](https://www.mediawiki.org/wiki/Special:MyLanguage/Manual:User_rights).
Namespace and full page title (including all subpage levels).
URL encoded namespace and full page title (including all subpage levels).
Full page title (including all subpage levels) without the namespace.
URL encoded full page title (including all subpage levels) without the namespace.
Page title of the page in the immediately superior [subpage](https://www.mediawiki.org/wiki/Special:MyLanguage/Help:Subpages) level without the namespace.
URL encoded page title of the page in the immediately superior [subpage](https://www.mediawiki.org/wiki/Special:MyLanguage/Help:Subpages) level without the namespace.
Name of the root of the current page.
URL encoded name of the root of the current page.
The [subpage](https://www.mediawiki.org/wiki/Special:MyLanguage/Help:Subpages) title. If no subpage exists the value of `{{PAGENAME}}` is returned.
The URL encoded [subpage](https://www.mediawiki.org/wiki/Special:MyLanguage/Help:Subpages) title. If no subpage exists the value of `{{PAGENAME}}` is returned.
Full page name of the associated subject (e.g. article or file). Useful on talk pages.

description: URL encoded full page name of the associated subject (e.g. article or file). Useful on talk pages.
Full page name of the associated talk page.
URL encoded full page name of the associated talk page.
Name of the page's namespace (except for main space)
URL encoded name of the page's namespace (except for main space)
[ID](https://www.mediawiki.org/wiki/Special:MyLanguage/Manual:Namespace#Built-in_namespaces) of the page's namespace
Name of the associated content namespace
URL encoded name of the associated content namespace
Name of the associated talk namespace
URL encoded name of the associated talk namespace

Used to include a vertical bar (pipe).

See [Help:Extension:ParserFunctions#Escaping pipe characters in tables](https://www.mediawiki.org/wiki/Special:MyLanguage/Help:Extension:ParserFunctions#Escaping_pipe_characters_in_tables) for further explanation.

Used to include an equal sign.

See [Help:Extension:ParserFunctions#Raw equal signs](https://www.mediawiki.org/wiki/Special:MyLanguage/Help:Extension:ParserFunctions#Raw_equal_signs) for further explanation.
**[Expensive]** Returns the byte size of the specified page.
